answers.answer: Not enough information.  A tumor is a very non specific term.The drug used for macular degeneration can also help many other eye problems from diabetes, vascular occlusion, macular pucker, etc.Dr. O.
That's all the information the retinologist told me.  He did mention thick calcification behind my eye, too.Thank you.

question: I've never had an eye exam done before until I noticed my vision was starting to get blurred.  I realized it was just my right eye and not both eyes.  After going to the eye doctor and then being sent to a retinologists right away, I found out I had a tumor in my eye.  The retinologists says it was probably congenital and very rare.  He thinks it's just a benign tumor.  He gave me an injection to prevent further vision loss.  But this injection has been studied in patients who had problems due to macular degeneration and not eye tumor.  It's only been a week.  He's just going to monitor and check my eye every 2-3 weeks.  Does anyone have any advice or suggestions for me?
title: Eye tumor
